intro: Lachenalia neilii, commonly known as the Neil's lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Lachenalia neilii is popular among succulent enthusiasts due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
